pageContext.claim: “'President Donald J. Trump is the greatest hostage negotiator that I know of in the history of the United States. 20 hostages, many in impossible circumstances, have been released in last two years. No money was paid.' Cheif Hostage Negotiator, USA!”
pageContext.analysis: Yes, Trump misspelled "chief" in his tweet. It's unclear who the source of this alleged statement is, but the White House has indicated it is Robert C. O'Brien, who serves as the Special Presidential Envoy for Hostage Affairs at the State Department. But that's not quite what O'Brien said: “This wouldn't happen with all of these hostages and detainees without the support of the president. The president has had unparalleled success in bringing Americans home without paying concessions, without prisoner exchanges, but through force of will and the goodwill that he’s generated around the world.” While the president likes to keep score on the hostages released under his watch, the evidence that Trump is freeing more hostages than his predecessors is scant. James O’Brien, a special presidential envoy for hostage affairs between 2015 and 2016, told The Washington Post the Obama administration freed roughly a hundred Americans abroad during that time.
